locations.name: Todo Culebra Plaza Hub
locations.description: Your one-stop hub in Culebra! Order food delivery, snorkel tours, e-bike rentals, and more. Shop at ShopCulebra.com

locations.name: Hector El Protector
locations.description: Culebra's beloved guardian troll, hand-carved from a fallen tree by Danish artist Thomas Dambo in 2014. Destroyed by Hurricane Maria in 2017 and lovingly rebuilt by the local community. Hector watches over the island and everyone on it. Stop by, say hello, and snap a photo â€” he loves the attention. ðŸ§Œ

locations.name: Zaco's Tacos Restaurant
locations.description: Culebra's most beloved taco spot. Fresh ingredients, bold flavors, and a laid-back vibe that keeps locals and visitors coming back. Don't leave the island without trying the fish tacos. Order delivery at ShopCulebra.com

locations.name: Mamacita's Restaurant & Bar
locations.description: An iconic Culebra institution right on the canal. Famous for the frozen painkiller cocktail and perfectly grilled fish. Watch the boats drift by while you sip â€” this is island life at its finest. Order delivery at ShopCulebra.com

locations.name: Dinghy Dock Restaurant
locations.description: Perched right over the water with tarpon swimming beneath your feet. Cold drinks, fresh seafood, and some of the best sunsets on the island. A true Culebra classic. Order delivery at ShopCulebra.com

locations.name: Heather's Pizza
locations.description: Hands down the best pizza on the island. Wood-fired with fresh, generous toppings and a perfectly crispy crust. Opens at 5pm â€” get there early or expect a wait. Worth every minute. Order delivery at ShopCulebra.com

locations.name: Playa Flamenco
locations.description: Consistently ranked one of the top 10 beaches in the world. Powder-white sand, crystal-clear turquoise water, and two iconic WWII tanks tucked behind the dunes. Facilities, food kiosks, and chair rentals on-site. Plan your day at ShopCulebra.com

locations.name: Tamarindo Beach
locations.description: One of the Caribbean's premier snorkel beaches. Swim alongside sea turtles, spotted eagle rays, and parrotfish in gin-clear water. Calm and shallow â€” perfect for all ages. Book a guided snorkel tour at ShopCulebra.com

locations.name: Malones Beach
locations.description: A hidden gem tucked along the marine reserve. Incredible reef snorkeling just steps from shore â€” fish, turtles, and rays in abundance. Short walk from town, rarely crowded. Rent snorkel gear at ShopCulebra.com

locations.name: Playa DÃ¡tiles
locations.description: Locals call it the most romantic beach on the island. Sweeping views of Cayo Luis PeÃ±a, Vieques, and El Yunque. Requires a 4x4 or e-bike â€” no golf carts. Bring water and sunscreen. Rent an e-bike at ShopCulebra.com

locations.name: Playa Zoni
locations.description: A long, wild, undeveloped stretch on the east end of the island. Stunning views of Culebrita, Cayo Norte, and St. Thomas. Sea turtle nesting ground. Camp right on the beach at culebracamping.com

locations.name: Punta Soldado
locations.description: The southernmost beach on Culebra. Rocky shoreline, powerful waves, and jaw-dropping views of Vieques. Best for experienced snorkelers â€” strong currents possible. 4x4 or e-bike only. Rent an e-bike at ShopCulebra.com

locations.name: Playa Carlos Rosario
locations.description: A well-kept secret accessible only by boat or a scenic hike. Pristine reef just offshore â€” among the best snorkeling on the island. No facilities, no crowds. Book a water taxi at ShopCulebra.com

locations.name: Playa Melones
locations.description: A short walk from town and absolutely worth it. Reef starts just feet from shore â€” strap on a mask and you are surrounded by tropical fish. Great sunset spot too. Rent snorkel gear at ShopCulebra.com

locations.name: Isla Culebrita
locations.description: A tiny uninhabited island with natural tidal pools (the famous jacuzzis!), a historic lighthouse, and some of the clearest water in the Caribbean. Boat access only. Book your boat trip at ShopCulebra.com

locations.name: Playa Brava
locations.description: Wild and windswept on the north coast. Accessible by trail from Flamenco or by boat. No facilities, no crowds â€” raw Caribbean coastline. Plan your adventure at ShopCulebra.com

locations.name: Snorkel With Locals
locations.description: The best way to see Culebra underwater. Local guides take small groups to secret snorkel spots â€” turtles, rays, nurse sharks, vibrant coral. All gear included. Book your tour at ShopCulebra.com

locations.name: Culebra Camping at Playa Zoni
locations.description: Fall asleep to waves and wake up to a Caribbean sunrise. Camping right on Playa Zoni â€” one of the most peaceful spots on the island. Tent sites and gear rental available. Reserve at culebracamping.com

locations.name: Kokomo Hotel
locations.description: Comfortable island accommodation in the heart of Culebra. Order food delivery to your room at ShopCulebra.com
